intro: Clerodendrum philippinum f. multiplex, commonly known as the Philippine glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
